description: a(1)=0; for k >= 1, let prime(k) map to 10...0 with k-1 zeros and let prime(k)*prime(m) map to the concatenation in binary of 2^(k-1) and 2^(m-1). For n >= 2, let the prime power factorization of n be mapped to r(n). a(n) is the term in A114994 which is c-equivalent to r(n) (see there our comment).
